entry.title: Setup SwiftUI App with Firebase SPM (Swift Package Manager, SwiftUI Tutorial, Firebase Crashlytics)

media:group.media:title: Setup SwiftUI App with Firebase SPM (Swift Package Manager, SwiftUI Tutorial, Firebase Crashlytics)
media:group.media:description:
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’ll be looking at how to integrate Firebase into our SwiftUI apps. We’ll see how to install Firebase using SPM (Swift Package Manager), we’ll also discuss the Firebase Console and setting up an App in your Firebase projects. Finally we’ll see how we can test our setup using Firebase Crashlytics to send and report a crash.
Timestamps
00:00 Introduction 00:23 Getting Started with Firebase SPM/Firebase Swift Package Manager 02:03 Installing Firebase with Swift Package Manager in Xcode 04:42 Setting up a project within the Firebase Console 06:11 Setting up an app for your project in the Firebase Console 11:39 Setting up Firebase Crashlytics in your Firebase project 15:23 Testing out Firebase Crashlytics in your project 18:47 Wrap up
Firebase SPM (Swift Package Manager) Installation https://github.com/firebase/firebase-ios-sdk/blob/master/SwiftPackageManager.md
Firebase Console https://console.firebase.google.com

entry.title: Refactoring code in SwiftUI (SwiftUI Tutorial, SwiftUI Onboarding, SwiftUI)

media:group.media:title: Refactoring code in SwiftUI (SwiftUI Tutorial, SwiftUI Onboarding, SwiftUI)
media:group.media:description:
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’ll look at and discuss a topic in programming called refactoring. We'll discuss the benefits of refactoring and how we can apply this to our Onboarding screens video which we built using SwiftUI. We'll also talk about when it may not be worth refactoring code and other bits of advice.
So let’s jump straight into this SwiftUI tutorial.

entry.title: SwiftUI Form Validation using Combine (SwiftUI Tutorial, Regular Expressions, Combine Framework)

media:group.media:title: SwiftUI Form Validation using Combine (SwiftUI Tutorial, Regular Expressions, Combine Framework)
media:group.media:description:
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’re going to be building a dynamic form in SwiftUI that accepts different types of inputs. We’ll then look at how we can apply some form validation in SwiftUI using regular expressions. So let’s jump straight into this SwiftUI Tutorial and see how we can apply some SwiftUI Form Validation
Timestamps
00:00 Introduction 00:35 Building our UI in SwiftUI 05:55 Breaking down our model 08:14 Building our model 13:09 Building our form content 16:00 Building our dynamic form 24:00 Getting our Regex Patterns 25:17 Breaking down our validators 27:05 Building our validators 34:50 Updating our models with our validators 38:80 Updating our form content with our validators 40:00 Using our validators to validate our text input 44:00 Passing objects between views with EnvironmentObject 49:00 Using out validator to validate our date selection 52:20 Handling button actions in our form 55:53 Using Enums to handle our entire Form Validation 01:03:47 Testing out our app 01:05:34 Wrap up

entry.title: Form Validation in UIKit using Combine Framework (Combine Framework, UIKit Tutorial, UIKit Form)

media:group.media:title: Form Validation in UIKit using Combine Framework (Combine Framework, UIKit Tutorial, UIKit Form)
media:group.media:description:
In this UIKit tutorial, we’re going to be building on top of our last video where we built a scalable and dynamic form in UIKit with a UICollectionView and using some of Apple’s latest frameworks UICollectionViewCompositionalLayout & UICollectionViewDiffableDataSource. This time we’ll be being using the Combine Framework to capture input from our UICollectionViewCell and also validate the users input.
So let’s jump straight into this UIKit tutorial.
Timestamps
00:00 Introduction 01:14 Breaking down the validators & model 05:56 Working with Regular Expressions in Swift 10:22 Building our date validator 11:42 Updating our models with our validator 18:32 Using Combine Framework to capture user input & handle validation in our textfield cell 27:27 Updating our single source of truth 29:15 Using Combine Framework to capture user input & handle validation in our date cell 31:38 Using Combine Framework to capture events in our button cell 34:00 Validating our form using Combine 39:13 Testing out our form 41:07 Fixing a bug with our form 42:25 Wrap up

entry.title: Getting Started With Unit Testing in Swift (XCTest, Test Cases, Code Coverage)

media:group.media:title: Getting Started With Unit Testing in Swift (XCTest, Test Cases, Code Coverage)
media:group.media:description:
In this Swift tutorial, we’ll be building on top of our Onboarding App that we built in our previous video and add in some unit testing. We’ll also discuss what is unit testing and how iOS unit testing works by breaking down our onboarding app’s logic. We’ll also discuss the what is included in XCTests and how to assert expressions to make sure our swift unit testing code works and validates our test cases, finally we’ll touch Xcode code coverage and see how we can use this to make sure we have applied unit testing in core areas of our app.
Timestamps
00:00 Introduction 00:13 Brief introduction to Unit Testing 01:48 How to add Unit Tests into an existing Xcode project 02:52 Adding XCTests & Unit Testing our Plist Manager 08:29 Adding XCTests & Unit Testing our Onboarding Content Manager 09:35 Creating Mocks 14:21 Enabling Code Coverage in Xcode 16:44 Wrap up
Build Onboarding Screens in SwiftUI (TabView, PageTabViewStyle, SwiftUI Tutorial, @AppStorage) https://youtu.be/HXYqU5ClIk4
Getting Started with Combine (Practical Combine Framework Examples in UIKit & SwiftUI) https://youtu.be/X2m0f2NoB10
Build a news app in SwiftUI tutorial series https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvUWi5tdh92zgFZ2UHvhhKrLyRyHXz8Jw
Build Clubhouse in SwiftUI 2.0 and Dark Mode (SwiftUI Tutorial, SwiftUI 2.0, Clubhouse App Clone) https://youtu.be/FVUPe5z1YG8

entry.title: Getting Started with Combine (Practical Combine Framework Examples in UIKit & SwiftUI)

media:group.media:title: Getting Started with Combine (Practical Combine Framework Examples in UIKit & SwiftUI)
media:group.media:description:
In this video, we’re going to explore the Combine Framework. In this Combine Framework tutorial, we’ll be looking at Practical examples in SwiftUI & UIKit. We’ll discuss a range of topics within the Combine Framework such as Publishers, Subscriptions, Cancellables, Memory Management and many more topics within the Combine Framework, alongside real-life examples you may come across in your project.
So let’s get straight into this SwiftUI tutorial & UIKit tutorial.
Timestamps
00:00 Introduction 00:53 Introduction to functional programming 06:06 Breaking down Reactive Programming 07:51 Subscriptions & Cancellables in the Swift Combine Framework 13:22 Combining Publishers in the Swift Combine Framework 22:44 Assigning Subscriptions in the Swift Combine Framework 30:52 CurrentSubjectValue in the Swift Combine Framework 40:16 PassthroughSubjects in the Swift Combine Framework 55:36 How to handle Multithreading 01:06:37 Memory Management in the Swift Combine Framework 01:10:51 Publishers in SwiftUI 01:20:13 Creating our own publishers using the Swift Combine Framework 01:24:40 Future & Deffered in the Swift Combine Framework 01:30:48 Wrap Up

entry.title: How I Became A Lead App Developer Without A Computer Science Degree (Self Taught Programmer)

media:group.media:title: How I Became A Lead App Developer Without A Computer Science Degree (Self Taught Programmer)
media:group.media:description:
In today’s video I’ll be talking about my self as a self taught programmer, specifically self taught iOS developer. And how I became a lead app developer or app tech lead at my current company. I’ll be sharing some tips and tricks on how to become a lead app developer, and some of the advice can also apply to someone who is looking at how to become a lead iOS developer or senior iOS developer on their iOS developer roadmap. So join me in this video as I discuss my iOS developer journey as a lead dev and as I go through some of the iOS lead essentials that I think are important. And if you have any other opinions I’d love to hear them in the comments section below.
Build a news app in SwiftUI tutorial series https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvUWi5tdh92zgFZ2UHvhhKrLyRyHXz8Jw
Build Clubhouse in SwiftUI 2.0 and Dark Mode (SwiftUI Tutorial, SwiftUI 2.0, Clubhouse App Clone) https://youtu.be/FVUPe5z1YG8
How to land your next iOS role and places to find a job https://youtu.be/-kxqoTCgxkI
#selftaughtprogrammer #iOSdevelopment #iOSdeveloperroadmap #howtobecomealeaddeveloper #iosdevelopment #leadiosdeveloper

entry.title: Dark Mode in SwiftUI using @Binding & @AppStorage (SwiftUI Tutorial, @Binding, @AppStorage)

media:group.media:title: Dark Mode in SwiftUI using @Binding & @AppStorage (SwiftUI Tutorial, @Binding, @AppStorage)
media:group.media:description:
00:00 Introduction 00:58 Breaking down SwiftUI AppStorage - Hacking With Swift 03:17 Using SwiftUI AppStorage & SwiftUI Binding 12:51 Handling Dark mode in SwiftUI with SwiftUI Binding 14:50 Using Colour Assets in Xcode to manage SwiftUI dark mode 20:32 Wrap up SwiftUI Tutorial
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’ll look at how we can add dark mode in SwiftUI. We’ll look at how we can use the combine framework in SwiftUI to use Binding to control the theme of our app to switch between dark mode, light mode and the system theme.
We’ll also look at how we can persist the settings for turning on SwiftUI dark mode, by using the AppStorage in SwiftUI which interacts with Userdefaults in Swift.
We’ll also look at how we can managed our colours with the Assets folder in Xcode so we can clearly define our Colour Assets in Xcode.
So let’s jump straight into this SwiftUI tutorial.
Build a news app in SwiftUI tutorial series https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLvUWi5tdh92zgFZ2UHvhhKrLyRyHXz8Jw
Build Clubhouse in SwiftUI 2.0 and Dark Mode (SwiftUI Tutorial, SwiftUI 2.0, Clubhouse App Clone) https://youtu.be/FVUPe5z1YG8
Swift Data Types https://docs.swift.org/swift-book/LanguageGuide/TheBasics.html

entry.title: How to land your first iOS developer job (Self Taught iOS Developer, iOS developer, SwiftUI)

media:group.media:title: How to land your first iOS developer job (Self Taught iOS Developer, iOS developer, SwiftUI)
media:group.media:description:
In this video we’ll be looking at places to get a job in iOS development, if you're an upcoming self taught iOS developer. We’ll be looking at site that are suitable for all people, if you’re a self taught iOS developer without a computer science degree, a graduate developer with a computer science degree or you’re just someone looking for a new iOS development challenge. Come and check out my tips, tricks and favourite sites for landing a developer job in iOS.

entry.title: Using UIKit in SwiftUI (SwiftUI Tutorial, SFSafariViewController, Xcode 12)

media:group.media:title: Using UIKit in SwiftUI (SwiftUI Tutorial, SFSafariViewController, Xcode 12)
media:group.media:description:
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’ll carry on improving our SwiftUI News App overall UI & UX, by using UIKit in SwiftUI. We’ll look at how we can open up links directly in our app rather opening up Safari.
We’ll be using a UIViewController called SFSafariViewController, this UIViewController allows us to open up links in a WebView. Since this is a UIKit view. We’ll see how we can use UIKit in SwiftUI with help of the UIViewControllerRepresentable protocol.
So let’s jump straight into this SwiftUI tutorial and see how to use UIKit in SwiftUI.
Timestamps
00:00 Intro 01:00 Creating our SFSafariView in SwiftUI 07:20 Presenting our SFSafariView using the sheet modifier in SwiftUI 12:15 Wrap Up

entry.title: SwiftUI Redacted Tutorial - Loading Skeleton View - (SwiftUI Tutorial, Xcode 12, SwiftUI 2.0)

media:group.media:title: SwiftUI Redacted Tutorial - Loading Skeleton View - (SwiftUI Tutorial, Xcode 12, SwiftUI 2.0)
media:group.media:description:
In this SwiftUI tutorial, we’ll carry on improving our SwiftUI News App overall UI & UX. We'll be providing a placeholder for our article views with the SwiftUI redacted modifier, replacing our loading view from previous videos and now implementing a swiftui skeleton view similar to Facebook. We’ll see how we can refactor our existing project and add in SwiftUI redacted into our project’s MVVM architecture in SwiftUI 2.0.
Timestamps
